comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-US; rv:1.9.2.9) Gecko/20110522 Red Hat/3.6.9-2.el6 Firefox/3.6.9
Build Identifier: 3.3a4pre (2011-06-01)

the Message Filters do not have an action item that allows an incoming email to be archived.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
Setup a new Message Filter

Select criteria to match against


Actual Results:  
In the actions its possible to delete, move it, copy it, change various flags etc but not to archive the email.

Expected Results:  
It would be great if an option can be added to the actions list that would archive the email, and honour the granularity settings for that mailbox.

User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-US; rv:1.9.2.9) Gecko/20110522 Red Hat/3.6.9-2.el6 Firefox/3.6.9

the Message Filters do not have an action item that allows an incoming email to be archived.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
Setup a new Message Filter

Select criteria to match against


Actual Results:  
In the actions its possible to delete, move it, copy it, change various flags etc but not to archive the email.

Expected Results:  
It would be great if an option can be added to the actions list that would archive the email, and honour the granularity settings for that mailbox.

+1

comments.text: I'm rather surprised that this functionality wasn't included already. Please add it soon. I would expect it to be relatively simple to do so...

comments.author: imdad.sk@gmail.com
comments.creator: imdad.sk@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
As I have multiple IMAP accounts setup in my Thunderbird it goes slow many times. I do archiving manually which is time taking task. Automating archiving through filters would be great feature to include in to Thunderbird.
I see this bug is not assigned to anyone yet. I hope this will be assigned to someone soon as when finished this feature will be used by many users.
comments.text:
